title: Acting members of boards
context: §26-36 Acting members of boards. The governor may appoint an acting member of any state board or commission to serve during the temporary absence from the State or the illness of any regular member thereof. The acting member shall, during the acting member&rsquo;s term of service, have the same powers and duties as the regular member. [L 1931, c 48, §1; RL 1935, §132; RL 1945, §481; RL 1955, §7-24; HRS §26-36; gen ch 1985]
